intro: Mascarenhasia pallida, commonly known as the pale Mascarenhasia, is a flowering plant native to the Mascarene Islands in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its pale yellow flowers and hairy stems, adapted to the dry, coastal environments of its native habitat. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, black seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
